subject: Relationships
title: Why Humans Invented Marriage
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Humans Invented Marriage.

hook.text: Marriage wasn't invented for love. It was invented to know which man's cattle went to which woman's children.

buildup.text: The earliest evidence of marriage-like bonds dates to 4,350 years ago in Mesopotamia â€” as property contracts.

discovery.text: Marriage solved a practical problem: who owns what, who raises whom, and which families ally with which.

twist.text: Romance had nothing to do with it. Marrying for love is a modern experiment â€” less than 250 years old.

climax.text: Marriage started as a business deal between families. Love was a bonus, not a requirement.

punchline.text: Marriage was invented for property, not love. Romance came later.

quiz.question: Why was marriage originally invented?
options: As property contracts and family alliances
